        public static final long FIRST_BIT_FLAGGED

        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • withCharacterPrecision

        public static GeoHash withCharacterPrecision(double latitude,
                                             double longitude,
                                             int numberOfCharacters)
        This method uses the given number of characters as the desired precision value. The hash can only be 64bits long, thus a maximum precision of 12 characters can be achieved.

      • withBitPrecision

        public static GeoHash withBitPrecision(double latitude,
                                       double longitude,
                                       int numberOfBits)
        create a new GeoHash with the given number of bits accuracy. This at the same time defines this hash's bounding box.

      • fromBinaryString

        public static GeoHash fromBinaryString(java.lang.String binaryString)

      • fromGeohashString

        public static GeoHash fromGeohashString(java.lang.String geohash)
        build a new GeoHash from a base32-encoded String.
        This will also set up the hashes bounding box and other values, so it can also be used with functions like within().

      • fromLongValue

        public static GeoHash fromLongValue(long hashVal,
                                    int significantBits)

      • geoHashStringWithCharacterPrecision

        public static java.lang.String geoHashStringWithCharacterPrecision(double latitude,
                                                                   double longitude,
                                                                   int numberOfCharacters)
        This method uses the given number of characters as the desired precision value. The hash can only be 64bits long, thus a maximum precision of 12 characters can be achieved.

      • next

        public GeoHash next(int step)

      • next

        public GeoHash next()

      • prev

        public GeoHash prev()

      • ord

        public long ord()

      • getCharacterPrecision

        public int getCharacterPrecision()
        Returns the number of characters that represent this hash.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the hash cannot be encoded in base32, i.e. when the precision is not a multiple of 5.

      • fromOrd

        public static GeoHash fromOrd(long ord,
                              int significantBits)

      • stepsBetween

        public static long stepsBetween(GeoHash one,
                                GeoHash two)
        Counts the number of geohashes contained between the two (ie how many times next() is called to increment from one to two) This value depends on the number of significant bits.
        Parameters:
        one -
        two -
        Returns:
        number of steps

      • getAdjacent

        public GeoHash[] getAdjacent()
        returns the 8 adjacent hashes for this one. They are in the following order:
        N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW

      • significantBits

        public int significantBits()
        how many significant bits are there in this GeoHash?

      • longValue

        public long longValue()

      • toBase32

        public java.lang.String toBase32()
        get the base32 string for this GeoHash.
        this method only makes sense, if this hash has a multiple of 5 significant bits.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the number of significant bits is not a multiple of 5.

      • within

        public boolean within(GeoHash boundingBox)
        returns true iff this is within the given geohash bounding box.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(WGS84Point point)
        find out if the given point lies within this hashes bounding box.
        Note: this operation checks the bounding boxes coordinates, i.e. does not use the GeoHashs special abilities.s

      • getPoint

        public WGS84Point getPoint()
        returns the WGS84Point that was originally used to set up this.
        If it was built from a base32-String, this is the center point of the bounding box.

      • getBoundingBoxCenterPoint

        public WGS84Point getBoundingBoxCenterPoint()
        return the center of this GeoHashs bounding box. this is rarely the same point that was used to build the hash.

      • getBoundingBox

        public BoundingBox getBoundingBox()

      • enclosesCircleAroundPoint

        public boolean enclosesCircleAroundPoint(WGS84Point point,
                                         double radius)

        public GeoHash getNorthernNeighbour()

        public GeoHash getSouthernNeighbour()
